page.title: 04VISITORS TO RAMSGATE
page.content: Ramsgate attracts three types of people--day trippers,foreign visitors and those coming here for several days. Locals refer to all holiday-makers as "visitors".The town grew as a holiday resort when people, especially Londoners, could make the return journey in a day. They came by train, charabanc and steamer.Now, most people come by car or coach.People from Kent and London make up the day visitors, but many come from the Midlands and North for longer holidays.70% of visitors are aged 45 and over, and many are retired or unemployed.75% are spending a second or third holiday here. Most visitors prefer bed,breakfast and evening meals accommodation.The beaches are the main attractions,followed by pubs and cafes. Foreign visitors often come over on the Sally ferry.
